title: Looking for a Chocolate Type Font
content:
I am in the process of creating a logo for a friend of mine who is a Chocolatier. She found a font she likes on some literature. Has anyone ever seen this font or anything close to it? I've been searching all over the Internet and cannot find anything similar. Someone may have created this font.

ANY help would be greatly appreciated, Karen

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MochaFont_6305.jpg)
author: Karen615

comments.content:
Could be hand made and not a font at all. And it would seem the "chocolateness" comes more from the color and depth effects than the lettering itself. Nevertheless, here are some similar typefaces:

[ITC Humana Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_humana_script/)  
 [John Handy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/john_handy/)  
 [ITC Riptide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/itc_riptide/)  
 [Ru'ach](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/ruach/)  
 [Twang](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/twang/)  
 [Ulysses](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/ulysses/)
I _love_ Zigarre. It's on the long list of 2006 honorable mentions that I still need to get on Typographica.

And sudtipos even have a font called [**Chocolate**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/3) and here is [**Veer's link**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109021450/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000147).

Thank you everyone for all your suggestions

Karen

Molten chocolate, wide brush, lots of paper and a camera – eat any mistakes or rejects.

Tim
